1. Establish a bedtime routine: Set a specific time each night for going to bed and waking up, and stick to it even on weekends.

2. Turn off electronics an hour before bedtime: Avoid using smartphones, tablets, or computers at least one hour before you plan to sleep.

3. Create a comfortable sleep environment: Keep your bedroom cool, dark, and quiet to promote better sleep.

4. Get regular exercise: Regular aerobic exercise helps improve sleep quality, reduce stress, and increase overall well-being.

5. Practice relaxation techniques: Incorporate relaxation techniques such as deep breathing, meditation, and yoga, into your routine to reduce stress and promote a good night's sleep.

6. Avoid caffeine and alcohol: Avoid drinking caffeine or alcohol before bedtime as they can disrupt sleep quality.

7. Set boundaries for electronics use: Limit your screen time each day and set rules for when and where you can use electronic devices.

8. Consider a tech-free hour before bedtime: Establish an hour of the day when all electronics must be turned off, allowing your body to relax and prepare for sleep.

9. Read or listen to calming music: Try listening to calming music or read a relaxing book before bedtime to help you wind down.

10. Seek medical advice: If you continue to struggle with sleep, talk to your doctor or a sleep specialist. They can help you identify any underlying causes and develop a treatment plan.
